column4: i just did a "service /serviceName /start" , how can i remove it?
replace 'start' with 'stop'?
BluesKaj , remove it
hmmm, perhaps you want to look at the 'update-rc.d' man page
no would be the answer to your last question i believe.. if i understand it correctly
, i have a service calle serviceName
:  service WowzaMediaServer stop          ===>   WowzaMediaServer: not running
roger
you look at the man page for 'update-rc.d'?
that's why you read the manual for it
update-rc.d <service_name> remove
=> "pdate-rc.d: /etc/init.d/WowzaMediaServer exists during rc.d purge (use -f to force)"
update-rc.d -f <service_name> remove
roger
i'm not a newb, but i am pretty rusty at linux right now
hmmm, i'm not sure then

you mean remotely or something?
i mean.. rebooting is pretty straightforward.... sudo reboot

roger. no worries.
